name: Methyl carbazate
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-4326
Reason: 1,3-Carbazole has a melting point of around 100°C. The methyl group (–CH3) can lower the melting point due to reducing the molecular weight and increasing the van der Waals interactions, which can lower it by approximately -10°C. The carbazole ring itself can also contribute to the melting point due to its rigidity and potential hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +20°C.
